name: Overview
data: [{"id":"546a02cf-3667-4fb5-afc3-1aadfad2750a","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor File Documentation","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"45ce8d11-b69e-4bc5-916d-c02321b283d7","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Overview","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"69b63585-8cd4-426d-b1fa-54b1f6450200","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"extProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" file serves as a core component in the static analysis engine, housing the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class. This module is designed to perform deep code inspection on Python source files by traversing their Abstract Syntax Trees (AST).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0c1e6195-49bd-4f15-9295-28bdeb013294","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Unlike simple linters that check for stylistic errors, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" builds a semantic model of the code. It tracks how data flows through variables, functions, and classes, resolving references and understanding the relationships between different parts of the codebase.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d640932c-6b96-40b9-ad17-1df64c58db7d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Capabilities","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3a7960bd-ea79-4842-9ddf-6155c04bce2c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The primary purpose of this file is to bridge the gap between raw code syntax and meaningful analysis. It accomplishes this through:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c445c20e-168c-420d-9004-978a3ac2f2fc","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"State-Aware Traversal:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It visits every node in the Python syntax tree while maintaining a \"memory\" of the current execution context (stack). This allows it to distinguish between variables with the same name in different scopes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2edadb04-6a89-4a97-b9e4-b6465aed6b7a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Symbol Resolution:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It resolves what a specific identifier refers to, linking usages back to their definitions (e.g., determining that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"my_func()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" refers to a specific function imported from another module).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1be8a7cd-db77-4d0d-a3a4-35fac25a8a78","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dependency Mapping:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It extracts and maps dependencies, including imports, inheritance structures, and function call graphs.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5d3b1846-9d7b-4c68-b722-f93095034598","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Control Flow Analysis:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It understands branching logic (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if/else","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and loops), merging potential outcomes to provide a complete picture of possible variable states.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bb27cd96-81d8-4a54-97e6-208ba77b6d56","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ExtProcessor Class","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"368cdd0f-5e43-40a6-bdd8-c5b737111a57","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The heart of this file is the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class, which inherits from a base processing class. It acts as the \"visitor\" that walks through the code structure.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ff374d1b-4736-43aa-a5df-1f7ea220b5a3","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it Works","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e97517fd-f2ca-4305-93bf-bc3253cae2c4","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Initialization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The processor is initialized with various \"managers\" (Import, Scope, Definition, Class, etc.) that act as databases for the information collected during analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d153d3a8-c18b-4289-8079-5509cb68a87a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Visitation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Using the visitor pattern, it recursively enters code blocks. For every significant Python construct (Function, Class, Assignment, Import), a specific handler is triggered.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bb3863c6-b01b-4e39-9111-6d00f1ade24a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Context Management:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" As it enters functions or classes, it pushes context onto an internal stack. As it leaves, it pops that context, ensuring that analysis remains localized to the correct scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"10e73026-fd8a-49f2-a306-a2300cfd7fe8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Extraction:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" During this process, it extracts structural data and \"points-to\" information, populating the managers with the results of the analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2d9e6350-f6c0-4f9f-b955-e0a0e90def53","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Integration","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b8e7bd16-33bd-4c55-976d-fa48a8fc9ed8","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This file is typically invoked by a higher-level driver that manages the file system or project structure. The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" does not usually run in isolation; it relies on the provided \"manager\" objects to store and retrieve the data it analyzes, making it part of a larger, interconnected analysis system.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d0eb5fb9-e7e5-4592-b4bb-4e71afa78825","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
